utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, I'm Rob and I just feel like I can't catch my breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how old are you Rob?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm I'm 50 I'm gonna be 50 soon.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, when did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, like last night I kinda had like an ache on my chest, kind of like here like on the left. I just I didn't do anything really last night and you know I just went to sleep and I got to sleep fine like I just thought maybe I pulled a muscle on this side. But then I woke up and I was like walking up the stairs and I like was kinda having a hard time breathing and I took some Tylenol. It didn't really do anything. Um, and then it just got worse and then a few hours ago is like I could barely walk. And if I'm breathing deep it's like it just hurts. And I feel like I can't like catch my breath like I can't get a good like a good breath in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, OK, so I just want to state at this point I would do ABC's, like I would do the vitals and make sure you're stable and then do airway breathing circulation if you weren't before I continue with the history. OK, so. OK, so that's how it started. Um, are you having any chest pain at all associated with that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like when I breathe in, I get like and it's like an ache. And then if I breathe really deep it feels like a little sharp.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have never had anything like this before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK, that was going to be my next question. On a scale of 1 to 10, how severe is your shortness of breath, 10 being the worst?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I don't, I don't know, um. Like I can breathe right now, I can't get like a deep breath, like...

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Does it? Oh sorry, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe like you know five or six.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Does it hurt when you take a deep breath in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's like it's like sharp.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sorry, sounds like you're having some pleuritic chest pain. Do you have any coughing associated with that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? You're not coughing up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any swelling in your legs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK, how about on exertion? Like when you walk or run, or you know, does it hurt more or does I mean sorry, does your shortness of breath get worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, it was like going up the stairs, can't really breathe in after.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about when you're laying down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know. I don't think that's any different. No, I slept fine last night. I got up and when I went up the stairs I was like holy...

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about wheezing? Are you experiencing any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I've noticed, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no, it's like it aches kind of it, but it's all up here and like kind of in my back a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, do you think anything triggered this?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK. And you said this has never happened to you before, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Does it get better with you sitting forward?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know, like I, I feel like that it's still kind of aching like it doesn't, it's not really like changing very much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. OK, any changes in your vision, hearing or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I mean, I've been trying to to lose weight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They told me a year ago I have like high blood pressure so I've been cutting out like salt and trying to walk more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, good.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I've lost like 15 pounds but like not... Like I've been trying to.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. 15 pounds, that's good. Are you experiencing any dizziness or you feeling faint?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just like a I can't get like a good breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you otherwise healthy? You mentioned you have high blood pressure, anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's that's like it. I've never had any like chest problems.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any investigations done for your chest like pulmonary function tests, ECG's, chest X-rays?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, they just they just put the thing on my arm. But my doctors office and said that it was high. So they said to you know, eat better and I don't I don't wanna start any drugs so, I didn't do anything. I've been fine ever since.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're not on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just yeah, no that's it. I mean I, you know sometimes take like a Tylenol if I'm not feeling well but...

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, like I, smoke a little bit. Maybe like a pack a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A pack a week, OK? For how long?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh like since college.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK OK. Um, do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. No, no and I I smoke, I'm trying to smoke less, you know, since they told me I have the high blood pressure. So I used to smoke a little more but this is this is less but not since I've been having trouble breathing. Is it, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. Any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. How about alcohol? Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh like, maybe you know, a beer on the weekend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like I don't I think I got all the ones when I was like a kid. What else should I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so like the flu vaccine every year?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, I get that, like my wife, my wife makes me get that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK that's good. Any family history of lung or heart disease?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh like my, uh, my mom and dad have high blood pressure too, so I wasn't surprised when I heard that I did.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Um, OK so Rob, is there anything that you wanted to tell me that I haven't asked you already today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am really like nervous 'cause I haven't felt anything like this before. Um, like it's scary, like do you think it's like cancer or something like I don't I don't really know?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, I mean, it's hard to tell right now what it is. It sounds like it's it started pretty suddenly, um, like it started a day ago, correct?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so it's unlikely that cancer would present itself like this so acutely, you know? And, but it could it could be a number of things like, it could be something like a pulmonary embolism, but you said you don't have any swelling. Um, but you did say you have some chest pain when you're breathing pretty, when you take a deep breath in. So I mean, that's a possibility. It doesn't sound like it's an infection because you don't have a fever or chills or any any other symptom really. And you mentioned there weren't any triggers like no trauma to the area. And then, other things could be like COPD because you which is a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease because you have been smoking since college and that's basically just inflammation in your lungs that causes your airways to narrow, and so you may have a hard time breathing. So for all of these things, we first start by doing some blood work and then we'll do some imaging like a chest X-ray and a pulmonary function test if indicated, and so that will give us a better idea of what you have and how we can best help you. Sounds good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah, I just really want to get a good breath so yeah, whatever we can do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure, and then in the meantime we'll keep monitoring you to make sure your vitals are OK and if we need to give you oxygen, we will.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That'd be great.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
